GPAT.gpat_q: Lactic acidosis is common adverse effect of the category of hypoglycemic drug
GPAT.reason: The biguanides are a class of oral hypoglycemic agents that are commonly used in the treatment of diabetes mellitus. Such agents include metformin, phenformin, and buformin. The use of phenformin was discontinued in the United States in 1976 because of probable association with lactic acidosis.

GPAT.gpat_q: Which of the following is a correct statement?
GPAT.reason:
The higher the Ka the stronger the acid. As a result, the reaction would favor a more complete dissociation of the weak acid, thus giving it a stronger ability to donate a proton (strong acid).

pKa is the opposite though, the larger the pKa, the weaker the acid is. This can be shown by just calculating pKa = -log(Ka).

The same relationship goes for kb and pKb. The larger the kb, the stronger the base, and the larger the pKb, the weaker the base.

GPAT.gpat_q: Swelling index of isabgol seeds
Water soluble portion of the gum tragacanth is known as
Stas-otto method is used for isolation of
GPAT.reason:
Stas-otto method. A method of extraction of alkaloids from plants and animal bodies: the substance is digested in alcohol and tartaric acid, the fatty and resinous matters are precipitated with water, the fluid is made alkaline, and the alkaloids are extracted with ether or chloroform. 

 The method by which glycoside are isolated is called stas-otto method. The drug containing glycoside is finely powdered and subjected to successive extraction in a soxhlet apparatus with alcohol or suitable solvent.

GPAT.gpat_q: Main constituent of honey is
GPAT.reason:
One 1980 study found that mixed floral honey from several United States regions typically contains the following: 
Fructose: 38.2% 
Glucose: 31.3%
Maltose: 7.1%
Sucrose: 1.3% 
Water: 17.2% 
Higher sugars: 1.5% 
Ash: 0.2% 
Other/undetermined: 3.2%

GPAT.gpat_q: Antidote for iodine poisoning
One of the following is used in open angle glaucoma
Tendon disrupture or tendonitis is side effect of
GPAT.reason: One well-described and serious adverse event associated with fluoroquinolones is tendinitis and tendon rupture. These injuries can result in long-term sequelae, including chronic pain and mobility restrictions, and may warrant surgical intervention.

GPAT.gpat_q: Penicillinase resistant penicillin antibiotic is
GPAT.reason: Methicillin, oxacillin, and nafcillin are few examples of Penicillinase resistant penicillins. These are the antibiotics, which are not inactivated by the penicillinase enzyme. Some bacteria produce the enzyme penicillinase that destroys the beta-lactam ring of the antibiotic, making the penicillin ineffective. Penicillinase resistant penicillins are used to treat resistant strains of staphylococci and other infections.

GPAT.gpat_q: The chemical shift (ppm) value for tetramethyl silane (TMS) is
A species having a tendency to accept a proton is
GPAT.reason: A Bronsted-Lowry base is a substance that accepts a proton in the form of a hydrogen (H) atom. This is why when we look at the Bronsted-Lowry acid-base reaction, the Bronsted-Lowry base is identified as the substance that gains a hydrogen atom.

GPAT.gpat_q: Who discovered the cell?
GPAT.reason: The cell was first discovered and named by Robert Hooke in 1665. He remarked that it looked strangely similar to cellula or small rooms which monks inhabited, thus deriving the name. However what Hooke actually saw was the dead cell walls of plant cells (cork) as it appeared under the microscope.

GPAT.gpat_q: Which substance yields the largest number of joules per gram?
GPAT.reason: Fats and ethanol have the greatest amount of food energy per gram, 37 and 29 kilojoules per gram (8.8 and 6.9 kcal/g), respectively. Proteins and most carbohydrates both have about 17 kJ/g (4 kcal/g).

GPAT.gpat_q: The term which describes the time required for the radioactivity of any given amount of a drug to be reduced by 50 percent is:
GPAT.reason: The half-life — t1/2, is the time taken for the activity of a given amount of a radioactive substance to decay to half of its initial value

GPAT.gpat_q: Conformation of organic molecules is MOST commonly determined by which ONE of the following analytical methods?
GPAT.reason: Conformational analysis is usually performed using NMR spectroscopy through measurement of coupling constants at room or low temperature in different solvents to determine the populations of conformers in solution. Quantum mechanical calculations are used to address the interactions responsible for conformer stability.

GPAT.reason: 1,3-dimethylxanthine is Theophylline and it has a role as a vasodilator agent, a bronchodilator agent, a muscle relaxant.

GPAT.gpat_q: Glimepiride exerts its hypoglycaemic action by
GPAT.gpat_a1: Causing a direct uptake of glucose by muscle cells
GPAT.gpat_a3: Stimulating insulin release from the pancreas
GPAT.reason: Like all sulfonylureas, glimepiride acts as an insulin secretagogue. It lowers blood sugar by stimulating the release of insulin by pancreatic beta cells and by inducing increased activity of intracellular insulin receptors.

GPAT.gpat_q: The therapeutic action of allopurinol in gout is due to its effect of:
GPAT.reason: Allopurinol and oxypurinol both inhibit xanthine oxidase, an enzyme in the purine catabolism pathway that converts hypoxanthine to xanthine to uric acid.

GPAT.gpat_q: Atropine
GPAT.gpat_a2: Is an antidote for anticholinesterase drugs
GPAT.reason:
Hyoscine is again more potent than atropine.
Atropine is a tertiary amine.

By competitively blocking the action of acetylcholine at muscarinic receptors, atropine may act as a specific antidote.

GPAT.gpat_q: Which ONE of the following is associated with gingival hyperplasia after long-term treatment?
GPAT.reason: Nifedipine is one of the commonest antihypertensive drugs (calcium channel blockers) used to treat hypertension and some forms of angina. Though it has various side effects, gingival enlargement is the most attended side effect which is of great importance in dentistry.

GPAT.gpat_q: All of the following statements about warfarin are correct EXCEPT for:
GPAT.gpat_a1: It resembles vitamin K in structure
GPAT.gpat_a2: It prevents the coagulation of blood in vitro
GPAT.gpat_a3: It has a delay in onset and reversal of action
GPAT.gpat_a4: It prevents synthesis of coagulation factors
GPAT.reason:
Anticoagulants prevent blood clotting (both in vivo and in vitro). Anticoagulants used in vivo are often termed blood thinners and act by interacting with cascade system while in vitro act by usually physical methods.

Warfarin decreases the body's ability to form blood clots by blocking the formation of vitamin K–dependent clotting factors means it acts in-vivo.

GPAT.gpat_q: Immediate source of energy for muscle contraction is
GPAT.reason: Muscles have two major proteins actin and myosin. These are mostly contractile proteins. The energy from the hydrolysis of ATP by myosin head is directly used in the power stroke i.e., flexing of myosin head during muscular contraction. ATP is also used during muscle relaxation in the absence of ATP the myosin head will continue to bind with actin head and the muscle fibre shall remain contracted. So, the correct answer is option C.

GPAT.gpat_q: Chemical nature of asbestos is
GPAT.reason: Asbestos, any of several minerals that readily separate into long, flexible fibres. Chrysotile, the fibrous form of the mineral serpentine, is the best-known type and accounts for about 95 percent of all asbestos in commercial use. It is a hydrous magnesium silicate with the chemical composition of Mg3Si2O5(OH)4.

GPAT.gpat_q: Psychrometric chart is related to
GPAT.reason: Psychrometric charts are complex graphs that can be used to assess the physical and thermodynamic properties of gas-vapour mixtures at a constant pressure. They are often used to assess the properties of moist air or Humidity.

GPAT.gpat_q: Magnesia magma is an example of
Mayer's reagent is :
GPAT.reason: Mayer's reagent is an alkaloidal precipitating reagent used for the detection of alkaloids in natural products. Mayer's reagent is freshly prepared by dissolving a mixture of mercuric chloride and of potassium iodide in water.
